title: wassupjoe
author: wassupjoe
content: I noticed that all the bounty campaigns in the Altcoins Marketplace board were for some amount of bitcoin or altcoin.Is it allowed to give away NFTs instead of coins or would that not be allowed?Thank you all

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: wassupjoe on December 02, 2022, 08:45:39 AMIs it allowed to give away NFTs instead of coins or would that not be allowed?Why would it be not allowed? If these projects that wanted to advertise can pay with illiquid coins/tokens, then I guess they're also allowed to pay illiquid NFTs.Not sure why any campaign applicant would want that though lol.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: wassupjoe on December 02, 2022, 08:45:39 AMI noticed that all the bounty campaigns in the Altcoins Marketplace board were for some amount of bitcoin or altcoin.Is it allowed to give away NFTs instead of coins or would that not be allowed?Thank you allYes I think since these nft are considered also as altcoin related projects. Even though there arent any tokens yet for the project and giving away nft as reward would totally fine at all.Either its liquid or not since its a form of incentive for the task on the bounty.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Since we don't know all the details, have a look at the stickies over at the Bounties section, and see if what you want to do breaks anything mentioned. If it does, it won't be allowed. If it doesn't, then it should be okay. If you have any queries related to those stickies then ask. This thread might be relevant too, as it depends what you mean by giveaway.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: wassupjoe on December 02, 2022, 08:45:39 AMI noticed that all the bounty campaigns in the Altcoins Marketplace board were for some amount of bitcoin or altcoin.Is it allowed to give away NFTs instead of coins or would that not be allowed?Thank you allAs you have noticed in the bounties section campaigns are based on altcoin or pay in bitcoin to you weekly or stake based and NFT is also token based on any of the blockchain so it is considered as token also belonging to altcoin and there might be members willing to get it.There were some campaign in the past in which they were giving away NFT along with the tokens so it's fine according to me but you need a campaign manager for it and then proceed further with it.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Quote from: aysg76 on December 02, 2022, 10:55:33 AMbut you need a campaign manager for it and then proceed further with it.Just to be clear to the original poster, you don't require a campaign manager as per forum rules. However, it's advisable by the community to do so. Although, you can run it yourself if you wished. There's no official rule, stating you need a campaign manager to run it. Also, recommended when ever dealing with actual Bitcoin or Altcoins that aren't distributed by the owners, that they're escrowed, but that doesn't seem to be the case here. Thought it'd be important to clarify that to avoid any confusion.
